meanings.definition: The state of being fully prepared or eager to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her readiness for the test was evident in how she had studied all week.
meanings.sent2: The team's readiness for the game was clear as they warmed up on the field.
meanings.sent3: His readiness to eat the entire cake surprised everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The soldier's readiness to defend his country was like a shield protecting his loved ones.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's readiness to rush into the burning building saved many lives that day.

meanings.definition: The quality of being willing and able to do something quickly.
meanings.sent1: The student's readiness to answer questions in class impressed the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's readiness to sprint at the starting line was unmatched.
meanings.sent3: The cat's readiness to pounce on the toy mouse was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The chef's readiness to cook a gourmet meal in minutes amazed the guests.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's readiness to fly into action at any moment made him a true hero in the city.
